1803.Event: Matthew Flinders completed the first circumnavigation of the continent

1804.Event: A settlement was founded at Risdon on the Derwent River in Van Diemen's Land

1813.Event: Blaxland, Lawson and Wentworth crossed the Blue Mountains.

1817.Event: John Oxley charts the Lachlan River

1824.Event: A penal colony was founded at Moreton Bay, now the city of Brisbane.

1825.Event: The New South Wales western border was extended to 129° E. Van Diemen's Land was proclaimed.

1826.Event: New South Wales established first settlement in Western Australia at King George Sound as a convict-supported military garrison, named Frederick Town but renamed Albany in 1832

1827.Event: The whole of Australia was claimed as British territory when Major Edmund Lockyer formally annexed the western portion in a ceremony at King George Sound.[8][9]

1829.Event: Charles Sturt charted the Darling River.

1830.Event: Sturt arrived at Goolwa, having charted the Murray River.

1831.Event: Administration of King George Sound passes to Swan River Colony, convicts returned to New South Wales.[8]

1832.Event: Swan River Colony had its name changed to Western Australia.

1833.Event: The penal settlement of Port Arthur was founded in Van Diemen's Land.

1834.Event: The Tolpuddle Martyrs are transported to Sydney and Hobart.

1835.Event: John Batman and John Pascoe Fawkner established a settlement at Port Phillip, now the city of Melbourne.

1836.Event: Province of South Australia proclaimed with its western border at 132° E.

1838.Event: First Prussian settlers arrived in South Australia; the largest group of non-British migrants in Australia at the time.

1839.Event: Paul Edmund Strzelecki became the first European to ascend and name Australia's highest peak, Mount Kosciuszko.

1840.Event: Australia's first municipal authority, the City of Adelaide, was established, followed by Sydney City Council.

1841.Event: New Zealand was proclaimed as a separate colony, no longer part of New South Wales.

1842.Event: Copper was discovered at Kapunda in South Australia.

1843.Event: Australia's first parliamentary elections was held for the New South Wales Legislative Council (though voting rights are restricted to males of certain wealth or property).

1845.Event: The ship Cataraqui was wrecked off King Island in Bass Strait. It is Australia's worst civil maritime disaster, with 406 lives lost.

1849.Event: Western Australia became a penal colony.

1850.Event: Australian Colonies Government Act [1850] granted representative constitutions to New South Wales, Victoria, South Australia and Tasmania. These colonies set about writing constitutions which produced democratically progressive parliaments.

1851.Event: Victoria separated from New South Wales.

1852.Event: Francis Cadell, in preparation for the launch of his steamer service, explored the Murray River in a canvas boat, travelling 1,300 miles (2,100 km) downstream from Swan Hill.[10]

1853.Event: First paddle steamers on Murray River on the spring flood. From South Australia, the Lady Augusta captained by Francis Cadell, reached Swan Hill while Mary Ann captained by William Randell, made it as far as Moama (near Echuca).[11]

1855.Event: The transportation of convicts to Norfolk Island ceased.

1856.Event: Van Diemen's Land name changed to Tasmania.

1857.Event: Victorian Committee reported that a 'federal union' would be in the interests of all the growing colonies. However, there was not enough interest in or enthusiasm for taking positive steps towards bringing the colonies together.

1858.Event: Sydney and Melbourne linked by electric telegraph.

1859.Event: SS Admella wrecked off south-east coast of South Australia with the loss of 89 lives.

1860.Event: John McDouall Stuart reached the centre of the continent. The South Australian border changed from 132° E to 129° E.

1861.Event: The ill-fated Burke and Wills expedition occurred.

1862.Event: Stuart reached Port Darwin, founding a settlement there. Queensland's western border was moved to 139° E.

1863.Event: South Australia took control of the Northern Territory which was previously part of the colony of New South Wales.

1867.Event: Gold was discovered at Gympie, Queensland.

1868.Event: The transportation of convicts to Western Australia ceased.

1869.Event: Children of Australian Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent are removed from their families by Australian and State government agencies. This practice lasted 100 years and is known as the Stolen Generation.

1872.Event: The Overland Telegraph Line linking Darwin and Adelaide opened.

1873.Event: Uluru was first sighted by Europeans, and named Ayers Rock.

1875.Event: SS Gothenburg strikes Old Reef off Bowen, North Queensland and sank with the loss of approximately 102 lives.

1877.Event: The first internationally recognised game of Test Cricket is played between Australia and England at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG).

1878.Event: First horse-drawn trams in Australia commenced operations in Adelaide.

1879.Event: The first congress of trade unions was held.

1880.Event: The bushranger Ned Kelly was hanged.

1882.Event: First water-borne sewerage service in Australia commenced operations in Adelaide.

1883.Event: The opening of the Sydney–Melbourne railway.

1888.Event: Louisa Lawson established The Dawn: A Journal for Australian Women.

1889.Event: The completion of the railway network between Adelaide, Brisbane, Melbourne and Sydney.

1890.Event: The Australian Federation Conference called a constitutional convention.

1891.Event: A National Australasian Convention met and agreed on adopting the name "the Commonwealth of Australia," also drafting a constitution.

1893.Event: The Corowa Conference (the "people's convention") called on the colonial parliaments to pass enabling acts, allowing the election of delegates to a new constitutional convention aimed at drafting a proposal and putting it to a referendum in each colony.

1894.Event: South Australia became the first Australian colony, and the second place in the world, to grant women the right to vote, as well the first Parliament in the world to allow women to stand for office with the Constitutional Amendment (Adult Suffrage) Act 1894.

1895.Event: The premiers, except for those of Queensland and Western Australia, agreed to implement the Corowa proposals.

1896.Event: The Bathurst Conference (the second "people's convention") met to discuss the 1891 draft constitution.

1897.Event: In two sessions, the Second National Australasian Convention met (with representatives from all colonies except Queensland present). They agreed to adopt a constitution based on 1891 draft, and then revised and amended it later that year. Catherine Helen Spence became the first female political candidate for political office, standing for election as a representative for South Australia.

1898.Event: The Convention agreed on a final draft to be put to the people.

1899.Event: The decision was made to site the national capital in New South Wales, but not within 100 miles of Sydney.

1900.Event: Several delegates visited London to resist proposed changes to the agreed-upon constitution.
